long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The Xen kernel SCSI backend and frontend driver is not enabled.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
kernel-4.5.3-300.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
100%
Steps to Reproduce: 1.[root@tst032 ~]# cat /boot/config-4.5.3-300.fc24.x86_64 |grep XEN_SCSI_ # CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_FRONTEND is not set # CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_BACKEND is not set
2. 3.
Actual results: [root@tst032 ~]# cat /boot/config-4.5.3-300.fc24.x86_64 |grep XEN_SCSI_ # CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_FRONTEND is not set # CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_BACKEND is not set
Expected results: [root@tst032 ~]# cat /boot/config-4.5.3-300.fc24.x86_64 |grep XEN_SCSI_ CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_FRONTEND=m CONFIG_XEN_SCSI_BACKEND=m
Additional info:
I've enabled this on f23-rawhide. Thanks for the report.
kernel-4.5.4-300.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-ef973efab7
kernel-4.5.4-200.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-9d91338972
